analysis.summary: Vue 3 component rendering a ‘Mobile App’ promotional section with a hero image, title, description, feature list and download links for App Store and Google Play, all driven by i18n content.
analysis.purpose: Provide a reusable section on the landing page to showcase and link to the mobile application in multiple languages.

components.name: SectionMobileApp
components.responsibility: Main wrapper component combining template, i18n logic and styling for the mobile app promo section.

components.name: LabelAppStore
components.responsibility: Render the App Store badge/icon inside a link.

components.name: LabelGooglePlay
components.responsibility: Render the Google Play badge/icon inside a link.

functions.name: t(key: string): string
functions.purpose: Translate and return a string or path based on the i18n messages provided via props.content.

functions.name: tm(key: string): any[]
functions.purpose: Return an array from the i18n messages (used for looping over 'features').
params: key — translation key pointing to an array (e.g. 'features')

functions.name: te(key: string): boolean
functions.purpose: Test whether a translation key exists in the provided messages (used to conditionally render links and labels).
params: key — translation key to test for existence

analysis.usage: Imported into a parent landing-page component (e.g. LandingPage.vue) and used as <SectionMobileApp :content="someI18nObject" />. The parent passes a localized content object matching the expected keys.
notes: Uses <script setup> syntax and the Composition API for brevity.
Relies on a global FILE_SERVER_URL variable to prefix the image path.
Mobile-first SCSS media query adjusts layout at max-width 1025px (centers text and stacks columns).
Conditional rendering of download links ensures absence of broken links if translations are missing.
CSS utility classes (cols-2, flex, w-100, etc.) presume a global utility stylesheet or framework.
